w:r.w:t: Project Blueprint: Scalable College Management System (CMS)
For The Group of Parekh Colleges, Under the Management of Shri Balvant Parekh Education Trust

This document outlines the final, comprehensive plan for developing a robust and scalable College Management System (CMS), hereinafter referred to as PCMS (Parekh Colleges Management System). The system is designed to manage all academic and administrative operations efficiently, ensuring full compliance with the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020 framework.
Implement support for the Credit-Based Choice System (CBCS), Multiple Entry/Exit, and Academic Bank of Credits (ABC).
Designed to easily integrate new Degree Programs (BBA, BCom, etc.) without re-engineering the core database structure.
Handle large student intake by managing multiple Divisions (A, B, C, etc.) within each Semester and Program.
Accurate tracking of Subject Types (Major, Minor, MDC, etc.) and separate allocation for Theory and Practical Credits.
The architecture focuses on non-complexity, high performance, and long-term maintainability, leveraging cloud services for critical components.
Responsive, mobile-first design for universal access by students and faculty.
Provides simplicity, speed, and modularity, making it ideal for the defined core academic logic.
CRITICAL for Scalability and Availability. Enterprise-grade reliability, data integrity, automatic backups, and disaster recovery managed by a cloud provider.
Standard, secure, and high-performance production environment.
The database will be hosted on a Managed Cloud PostgreSQL Service. This strategy ensures:
High Availability: Automatic failover and replication across zones.
Reduced Overhead: Automated patching, backups, and maintenance.
Security: Enhanced network security (VPC), encryption at rest and in transit (SSL/TLS).
Scalability: Ability to instantly adjust compute and storage capacity as the college's data footprint grows.
The CMS core academic structure is built around the following highly granular components:
Every subject must be defined with both its Type and its Credit Split.
Core discipline subjects (e.g., Programming). Highest credit weight.
Subjects taken from outside the primary program.
Mandatory for skill or value enhancement (e.g., Environmental Studies).
Vocational/Skill-based training with a high Practical focus.
Courses related to traditional Indian knowledge systems.
All academic records must distinguish between these two credit types for a single subject:
Total Credits = Theory Credits + Practical Credits.
Marks/Grades are recorded separately for each component.
The system tracks the total credits earned via the
table to determine eligibility for various exit points:
Flag student as eligible when min. credits are met.
Flag student as eligible when min. credits are met.
Final credit tally and degree award.
Access control is rigidly defined based on the organizational structure, filtered by Program, Semester, and Division.
Full R/W control over all tables. Configure Programs, Divisions, and User Accounts.
R/W on Faculty assignment. Read-Only access to all data (Attendance, Grades, Fees) for their assigned Program (e.g., all BCA).
R/W on Attendance, Assignment creation, and Grade entry ONLY for their assigned Subject, Semester, and Division.
R/W on Admissions, Student Profile updates, Fees records. R/W on System-wide Announcements.
Read-Only access to their own profile, attendance, grades, and course content.
Assigns incoming students to an available Division (A, B, C, etc.) within their starting Semester. Uses
Number as the permanent unique ID.
Defines Semester structure, links Subjects to a Semester, assigns Subject Type and Theory/Practical Credits.
Assigns Faculty to a specific Subject, Semester, and Division (via
Faculty marks P/A. The system ensures the faculty member only sees the list of students belonging to their assigned Division. Generates aggregate reports by Division.
Faculty enters separate marks for Theory and Practical components. The system calculates Semester GPA and updates the Credit Log.
Faculty shares course material, filtered by Subject, Semester, and Division. Students only see relevant materials.
Displays critical, system-wide messages prominently on the dashboard for all user roles.
Provides analytics and compliance checks: GPA comparison across Divisions; list of students eligible for NEP Exit Points.
Tracks fee structure, payment history, and outstanding balances per student.
The schema is highly normalized to support all required relationships, including the crucial linking of Division, Semester, and Subject Type.
